title: Enacts bill of adoptee rights clarifying language and procedures for obtaining birth certificates and medical histories for adoptees
summary: Enacts Bill of Adoptee Rights clarifying language and procedures for obtaining birth certificates and medical histories of adoptees; permits an adopted adult to access certain records when they reach the age of 18; creates a contact preference to be filed by birth parents.

       AN ACT to amend the public health law and the domestic relations law, in
         relation to enacting the "bill of adoptee rights"

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The public health law is amended by adding  a  new  section
    2  4138-e to read as follows:
    3    S  4138-E.  BILL OF ADOPTEE RIGHTS. 1. THIS SECTION SHALL BE KNOWN AND
    4  MAY BE CITED AS THE "BILL OF ADOPTEE RIGHTS".
    5    2. THE LEGISLATURE HEREBY STATES ITS INTENTION TO ACKNOWLEDGE, SUPPORT
    6  AND ENCOURAGE THE LIFE-LONG HEALTH AND WELL-BEING NEEDS OF  PERSONS  WHO
    7  HAVE  BEEN AND WILL BE ADOPTED IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK. THE LEGISLATURE
    8  FURTHER RECOGNIZES THAT THE DENIAL OF ACCESS TO  ACCURATE  AND  COMPLETE
    9  MEDICAL  AND  SELF-IDENTIFYING  DATA  OF  ANY  ADOPTED PERSON, KNOWN AND
   10  WILFULLY WITHHELD BY OTHERS, MAY RESULT IN  SUCH  PERSON  SUCCUMBING  TO
   11  PREVENTABLE  DISEASE,  PREMATURE DEATH OR OTHERWISE UNHEALTHY LIFE, IS A
   12  VIOLATION OF THAT PERSON'S HUMAN RIGHTS AND IS CONTRARY TO THE TENETS OF
   13  GOVERNANCE. AS SUCH, THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION  SEEK  TO  ESTABLISH
   14  CONSIDERATIONS UNDER THE LAW FOR ADOPTED PERSONS EQUAL TO SUCH CONSIDER-
   15  ATIONS PERMITTED BY LAW TO ALL NON-ADOPTED PERSONS; THIS SECTION DOES SO
   16  WHILE  PROVIDING  FOR  THE  PRIVACY  OF AN ADOPTED PERSON AND HIS OR HER
   17  BIRTH AND ADOPTIVE FAMILIES.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01540-01-1

       A. 2003                             2

    1    3. (A) NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF  LAW,  WHEN  AN  ADOPTED
    2  PERSON  ATTAINS  THE  AGE  OF EIGHTEEN YEARS, THAT PERSON SHALL HAVE THE
    3  RIGHT TO RECEIPT OF A NON-CERTIFIED COPY OF HIS OR  HER  ORIGINAL  (LONG
    4  FORM,  LINE  BY LINE VAULT COPY) BIRTH CERTIFICATE AND ANY CHANGE HIS OR
    5  HER  BIRTH  PARENT  OR  PARENTS  MAY  HAVE ATTACHED TO THAT CERTIFICATE,
    6  AND/OR A MEDICAL HISTORY FORM IF AVAILABLE, UPON APPLICATION,  PRESENTA-
    7  TION OF PROOF OF IDENTIFICATION AND THE PAYMENT OF A NOMINAL FEE.
    8    (B)  WHEN IT SHALL BE IMPOSSIBLE THROUGH GOOD-FAITH EFFORTS TO PROVIDE
    9  A COPY OF AN ADULT ADOPTED PERSON'S ORIGINAL BIRTH  CERTIFICATE  (AS  IN
   10  THE  CASE  OF AN ADOPTED PERSON BORN OUTSIDE OF, BUT ADOPTED WITHIN, THE
   11  STATE OF NEW YORK), THE ADULT ADOPTED PERSON SHALL  HAVE  THE  RIGHT  TO
   12  SECURE  FROM  A  COURT OF COMPETENT JURISDICTION OR THE ADOPTION AGENCY,
   13  THE TRUE AND CORRECT IDENTIFYING INFORMATION THAT WOULD HAVE APPEARED ON
   14  HIS OR HER ORIGINAL BIRTH CERTIFICATE. IN SUCH CASE THE AGENCY SHALL  BE
   15  HELD HARMLESS FROM ANY LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THE DISCLOSURE.
   16    4.  A  BIRTH  PARENT  MAY  AT  ANY  TIME REQUEST FROM THE DEPARTMENT A
   17  CONTACT PREFERENCE FORM THAT SHALL ACCOMPANY A BIRTH CERTIFICATE  ISSUED
   18  UNDER  THIS TITLE. THE CONTACT PREFERENCE FORM SHALL PROVIDE THE FOLLOW-
   19  ING INFORMATION TO BE COMPLETED AT THE OPTION OF THE BIRTH PARENT:
   20    (A) I WOULD LIKE TO BE CONTACTED.
   21    (B) I WOULD PREFER TO BE CONTACTED ONLY THROUGH AN INTERMEDIARY.
   22    (C) I HAVE COMPLETED A MEDICAL HISTORY FORM AND HAVE FILED IT WITH THE
   23  DEPARTMENT.
   24    (D) PLEASE DO NOT CONTACT ME. IF I DECIDE LATER THAT I WOULD  LIKE  TO
   25  BE  CONTACTED,  I  WILL SUBMIT AN UPDATED CONTACT PREFERENCE FORM TO THE
   26  DEPARTMENT.
   27    THE MEDICAL HISTORY FORM SHALL BE IN A FORM PRESCRIBED BY THE  DEPART-
   28  MENT AND SHALL BE SUPPLIED TO THE BIRTH PARENT UPON REQUEST OF A CONTACT
   29  PREFERENCE FORM FROM THE DEPARTMENT.
   30    ONLY  THOSE  PERSONS  WHO  ARE AUTHORIZED TO PROCESS APPLICATIONS MADE
   31  UNDER THIS TITLE MAY PROCESS  CONTACT  PREFERENCE  AND  MEDICAL  HISTORY
   32  FORMS.
   33    THE  MEDICAL HISTORY FORM AND CONTACT PREFERENCE FORM ARE CONFIDENTIAL
   34  COMMUNICATIONS FROM THE BIRTH PARENT TO THE PERSON NAMED ON  THE  SEALED
   35  BIRTH  CERTIFICATE AND SHALL BE PLACED IN SEPARATE SEALED ENVELOPES UPON
   36  RECEIPT FROM THE BIRTH PARENT. THE SEALED  ENVELOPES  SHALL  BE  MATCHED
   37  WITH AND PLACED IN THE FILE CONTAINING THE SEALED BIRTH CERTIFICATE.
   38    THE  SEALED  ENVELOPES  CONTAINING  THE  CONTACT  PREFERENCE  FORM AND
   39  MEDICAL HISTORY FORM MAY BE RELEASED TO A PERSON REQUESTING HIS  OR  HER
   40  OWN  ORIGINAL BIRTH CERTIFICATE UNDER THIS TITLE. THE CONTACT PREFERENCE
   41  FORM AND MEDICAL HISTORY FORM ARE PRIVATE COMMUNICATIONS FROM THE  BIRTH
   42  PARENT TO THE PERSON NAMED ON THE SEALED BIRTH CERTIFICATE AND NO COPIES
   43  OF  THE FORMS SHALL BE RETAINED BY THE DEPARTMENT.  WHERE ONLY A MEDICAL
   44  HISTORY FORM IS REQUESTED THE BIRTH CERTIFICATE AND  CONTACT  PREFERENCE
   45  FORM SHALL NOT BE SENT, BUT MAY BE REQUESTED AT A LATER DATE.
   46    S  2.  Subdivision  5  of  section  4138  of the public health law, as
   47  amended by chapter 201 of the laws  of  1972,  is  amended  to  read  as
   48  follows:
   49    5.  Thereafter,  when  a certified copy or certified transcript of the
   50  certificate of birth of such a person, or a certification of  birth  for
   51  such  person  is  issued,  it shall be based upon the new certificate of
   52  birth, except when an order of a court of competent  jurisdiction  shall
   53  require  the  issuance of a copy of the original certificate of birth OR
   54  UPON A WRITTEN NOTARIZED REQUEST BY THE ADULT ADOPTED PERSON HIMSELF  OR
   55  HERSELF ONCE PROPER PROOF OF IDENTITY IS PROVIDED TO THE REGISTRAR.

   11    S  4.  Subdivision  7  of  section  4138  of the public health law, as
   12  amended by chapter 644 of the laws  of  1988,  is  amended  to  read  as

   14    7.  Whenever  the  commissioner  makes a new birth certificate for any
   15  person pursuant to the provisions of subdivision one of this section, he
   16  OR SHE shall forward to such person, if eighteen years of age  or  more,
   17  [or  to the parents of such person,] a certified copy, a certified tran-

   19  ate under the circumstances,] without making any charge therefor.
   20    S  5.  Section  4138 of the public health law is amended by adding two
   21  new subdivisions 8 and 9 to read as follows:
   22    8. (A) AN ADOPTED PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER, OR THE  BIRTH
   23  PARENT  OR  PARENTS,  MAY  SUBMIT TO THE REGISTRAR A NOTICE OF CHANGE OF
   24  NAME AND/OR ADDRESS AND  SUCH  INFORMATION  SHALL  BE  ATTACHED  TO  THE
   25  ORIGINAL BIRTH CERTIFICATE OF THE ADOPTED PERSON.
   26    (B)  THE  REGISTRAR  SHALL  DISCLOSE TO THE BIRTH PARENT OR PARENTS AT
   27  SUCH PARENT'S OR PARENTS' REQUEST, THE MOST CURRENT NAME AND ADDRESS  OF
   28  AN  ADOPTED  PERSON  IF THAT ADOPTED PERSON HAS REQUESTED SO BY FILING A
   29  NOTARIZED LETTER WITH THE REGISTRAR.
   30    9. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, WHEN AN ADOPTED  PERSON
   31  ATTAINS  THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN YEARS, HE OR SHE SHALL HAVE THE RIGHT, UPON
   32  APPLICATION, PROOF OF IDENTITY AND  PAYMENT  OF  A  NOMINAL  FEE,  TO  A
   33  NON-CERTIFIED COPY OF HIS OR HER ORIGINAL LONG FORM, LINE BY LINE, VAULT
   34  COPY BIRTH CERTIFICATE AND/OR A MEDICAL HISTORY FORM, IF AVAILABLE.
   35    S  6.   Paragraph (b) of subdivision 3 of section 4138-d of the public
   36  health law, as amended by chapter 181 of the laws of 2010, is amended to
   37  read as follows:
   38    (b) If the agency determines that the  agency  was  involved  in  such
   39  adoption, it shall transmit the registration to the adoption information
   40  registry  operated  by  the  department and the agency shall release the
   41  non-identifying information, as defined  in  section  forty-one  hundred
   42  thirty-eight-c of this title, to the [adoptee registrant. The agency may

   45  non-identifying information would not be in the adoptee's,  the  biolog-

   47    S  7. Section 4104 of the public health law, as amended by chapter 435

   49    S 4104. Vital statistics; application of article.  The  provisions  of

   56  THREE, AND SUBDIVISIONS FIVE, SEVEN, EIGHT  AND  NINE  of  section  four

    1  thousand  one  hundred  thirty-eight, subdivision eleven of section four
    2  thousand one hundred thirty-eight-c, PARAGRAPH (B) OF SUBDIVISION  THREE
    3  OF  SECTION FOUR THOUSAND ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-EIGHT-D, SECTION FOUR THOU-
    4  SAND  ONE  HUNDRED  THIRTY-EIGHT-E and section four thousand one hundred

    6    S 8. Subdivision 1 of section 114 of the domestic  relations  law,  as
    7  amended by chapter 751 of the laws of 1989 and designated by chapter 601
    8  of the laws of 1994, is amended to read as follows:
    9    1.  If satisfied that the best interests of the adoptive child will be
   10  promoted thereby, the judge or surrogate shall make an  order  approving
   11  the  adoption and directing that the adoptive child shall thenceforth be
   12  regarded and treated in all  respects  as  the  child  of  the  adoptive
   13  parents  or  parent.  In  determining  whether the best interests of the
   14  adoptive child will be promoted by the adoption, the judge or  surrogate
   15  shall give due consideration to any assurance by a LOCAL commissioner of
   16  social  services that he OR SHE will provide necessary support and main-
   17  tenance for the adoptive child pursuant to the social services law. Such
   18  order shall contain the full name, date and place of birth and reference
   19  to the schedule annexed to the petition containing the  medical  history
   20  of  the  child  in  the  body  thereof and shall direct that the child's
   21  medical history, heritage of the  BIRTH  parents,  which  shall  include
   22  nationality,  ethnic  background and race; education, which shall be the
   23  number of years of school completed by the BIRTH parents at the time  of
   24  the  birth  AND  ALSO  AT  THE  TIME OF SURRENDER of the adoptive child;
   25  general physical appearance of the BIRTH parents  at  the  time  of  the
   26  birth  AND  ALSO  AT  THE TIME OF SURRENDER of the adoptive child, which
   27  shall include height, weight, color of hair, eyes, skin;  occupation  of
   28  the  BIRTH  parents  at  the  time  of the birth AND ALSO AT THE TIME OF
   29  SURRENDER of the adoptive child; health and medical history of the BIRTH
   30  parents at the time of the birth AND ALSO AT THE TIME  OF  SURRENDER  of
   31  the  adoptive  child,  including all available information setting forth
   32  conditions or diseases believed to be hereditary, any drugs  or  medica-
   33  tion  taken  during  the  pregnancy by the child's mother; and any other
   34  information which may be a factor influencing  the  child's  present  or
   35  future  health,  INCLUDING THE talents, hobbies and special interests of
   36  THE BIRTH parents as contained in the  petition,  be  furnished  to  the
   37  adoptive  parents.  IN RECOGNITION OF THE IMPERATIVE LIFELONG IMPORTANCE
   38  OF SUCH INFORMATION FOR THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF THE ADOPTED PERSON,
   39  IT SHALL BE THE DUTY OF THE LAW GUARDIAN AS PROVIDED FOR BY SECTIONS TWO
   40  HUNDRED FORTY-ONE, TWO HUNDRED FORTY-TWO, TWO HUNDRED FORTY-NINE AND TWO
   41  HUNDRED FORTY-NINE-A OF THE FAMILY COURT ACT TO ENSURE THE COMPREHENSIVE
   42  COMPLETION AND FILING OF ALL THE ABOVE REFERENCED INFORMATION  PRIOR  TO
   43  THE  ACCEPTANCE  OF THE TERMINATION OF PARENTAL RIGHTS OR THE ENTRY OF A
   44  CERTIFICATE OF ADOPTION. IT SHALL BE DEEMED BY THAT LEGAL REPRESENTATIVE
   45  THAT SUCH INFORMATION IS ALWAYS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE CHILD AND IS
   46  A PROTECTED RIGHT. PRIOR TO TERMINATION OF  DUTIES,  SUCH  LAW  GUARDIAN
   47  SHALL  PROVIDE,  AS DIRECTED BY SECTION FORTY-ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-EIGHT-C
   48  OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW AND SECTIONS THREE  HUNDRED  SEVENTY-THREE  AND
   49  THREE HUNDRED SEVENTY-THREE-A OF THE SOCIAL SERVICES LAW, TO THE RESPEC-
   50  TIVE RESPONSIBLE PARTIES ALL SUCH COLLECTED DATA, AND PROVIDE AN AFFIDA-
   51  VIT  TO  THE COURT REPORTING ALL DILIGENT EFFORTS TO OBTAIN SUCH DATA. A
   52  COPY OF SUCH AFFIDAVIT SHALL BE APPENDED TO THE ORIGINAL AND ANY AND ALL
   53  AMENDED BIRTH CERTIFICATES. If the judge or surrogate is also  satisfied
   54  that  there  is  no reasonable objection to the change of name proposed,
   55  the order shall direct that the name of the adoptive child be changed to
   56  the name stated in the agreement of adoption and that henceforth  he  OR

       A. 2003                             5

    1  SHE  shall be known by that name. All such orders made by a family court
    2  judge of Westchester county  since  September  first,  nineteen  hundred
    3  sixty-two,  and on file in the office of the county clerk of such county
    4  shall  be  transferred  to the clerk of the family court of such county.
    5  Such order and all the papers in the proceeding shall be  filed  in  the
    6  office of the court granting the adoption and the order shall be entered
    7  in  books  which  shall be kept under seal and which shall be indexed by
    8  the name of the adoptive parents and by the full original  name  of  the
    9  child. Such order, including orders heretofore entered, shall be subject
   10  to  inspection  and  examination  only as hereinafter provided. Notwith-
   11  standing the fact that adoption records shall be sealed and secret, they
   12  may be microfilmed and processed pursuant to  an  order  of  the  court,
   13  provided  that  such  order  provides  that  the confidentiality of such
   14  records be maintained. If the confidentiality is violated, the person or
   15  company violating it can be found guilty of contempt of court. The  fact
   16  that  the adoptive child was born out of wedlock shall in no case appear
   17  in such order. The written report of the investigation together with all
   18  other papers pertaining to the adoption shall be kept by  the  judge  or
   19  surrogate as a permanent record of his OR HER court and such papers must
   20  be  sealed by him OR HER and withheld from inspection. No certified copy
   21  of the order of adoption shall issue unless authorized by  court  order,
   22  except  that certified copies may issue to the agency or agencies in the
   23  proceeding prior to the sealing of the  papers.  Before  the  record  is
   24  sealed,  such  order may be granted upon written ex parte application on
   25  good cause shown and upon such conditions as the court may impose. After
   26  the record is sealed, such order may be  granted  only  upon  notice  as
   27  hereinafter provided for disclosure or access and inspection of records.
   28  The  clerk  upon  request  of  a person or agency entitled thereto shall
   29  issue certificates of adoption which shall contain only the new name  of
   30  the  child and the date and place of birth of the child, the name of the
   31  adoptive parents and the date when and  court  where  the  adoption  was
   32  granted,  which  certificate  as to the facts recited therein shall have
   33  the same force and effect as a certified copy of an order of adoption.
   34    S 9. Section 114 of the domestic relations law is amended by adding  a
   35  new subdivision 5 to read as follows:
   36    5.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, WHEN AN ADOPTED PERSON
   37  ATTAINS THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN YEARS, SUCH ADOPTED PERSON  SHALL  HAVE  THE
   38  RIGHT, UPON APPLICATION, PROOF OF IDENTITY AND PAYMENT OF A NOMINAL FEE,
   39  TO  A NON-CERTIFIED COPY OF HIS OR HER ORIGINAL LONG FORM, LINE BY LINE,
   40  VAULT COPY BIRTH CERTIFICATE AND/OR MEDICAL HISTORY FORM, IF AVAILABLE.
   41    S 10. This act shall take effect on the first of January next succeed-
   42  ing the date on which it shall have become  a  law,  provided,  however,
   43  that,  effective  immediately, the commissioner of health is directed to
   44  promulgate such rules and regulations as may be necessary to  carry  out
   45  the provisions of this act.
